Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lekanis lid (or the like); underside glazed save for one reserved band framed by added red bands; underside of rim reserved; exterior, from centre: palmette-lotus frieze with red on centre of lotus; black-figure decoration consisting of lion to right, looking back (forepart with red on neck remaining); band in added red.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The suffix "i" was added by the British Museum's Naukratis cataloguing project to distinguish the sherd from other 1912.33 sherds.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 337-8, no. B 401)
Möller 2000 / Naukratis, Trade in Archaic Greece (p. 224, no. 5)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0782) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 91, pl. I, no. 12.)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
